coffees.name: Villa Rosario
coffees.description:
Caranavi, located in the high mountains of the La Paz region in western Bolivia, sits at the gateway to the Amazon at an altitude of over 1550 meters. This altitude, combined with the region's fertile soil and ideal climate, creates perfect conditions for growing high-quality coffee. Roger Guzmán, a dedicated producer in Villa Rosario, meticulously cares for his farm, where he grows a mix of Caturra and Catuai varieties with precision and care.

Harvesting is done entirely by hand, ensuring that only the ripest cherries are selected at their peak. Once collected, the cherries undergo a washing process, which begins with a controlled 48-hour fermentation in stainless steel tanks. This step is crucial for developing the coffee's clarity and complexity, enhancing its distinctive flavor profile. After fermentation, the beans are thoroughly washed and then dried using a mechanical dryer over a period of 110 hours. This slow and uniform drying process ensures optimal moisture levels and preserves the coffee's inherent characteristics.

Roger Guzmán's meticulous approach to cultivation and processing results in a clean and vibrant cup that embodies Caranavi's unique terroir. His dedication to quality and precision highlights the exceptional flavors that this high-altitude region has to offer.

coffees.name: Pampojila
coffees.description: The Mayans called this remarkable land Pampojilá 'land where misty clouds rise'. Finca Pampojilá is rich in volcanic soil in the upper part of the Atitlán Volcano, rising above Lake Atitlán, where the south wind almost daily brings a cover of humid clouds, providing natural shade to the coffee trees in the afternoon. Pampojilá was founded and formally registered in the late 19th century. For over 150 years, the farm has been in coffee production in the beautiful mountains south of Lake Atitlán, and for many decades has been known for its high-quality coffees. In 2012, the Herrera family acquired the farm and renovated it after the floods of tropical storm Agatha.

coffees.name: Campo Hermoso
coffees.description: Finca Campo Hermoso (1750-1900 m.a.s.l.) located in Circasia, Quindío, Colombia, is a 25-hectare farm known for its unique experimental coffees. Led by Edwin Noreña, a fourth-generation farmer and coffee innovator, the farm produces exceptional and distinctive profiles. He has developed a unique co-fermentation technique inspired by the craft beer industry. By adding compounds like hops and dehydrated fruits to the fermentation tanks, Edwin creates distinctive flavors that complement the natural fermentation process.

coffees.name: Campo Hermoso
coffees.profile: Orange, grapefruit, green apple and flowers
coffees.description: Finca Campo Hermoso located in Quindío, Colombia, is a farm known for its unique experimental coffees. Led by Edwin Noreña, a fourth-generation farmer and coffee innovator, the farm produces exceptional and distinctive profiles with carefully controlled fermentation processes.

coffees.name: Watermelon
coffees.profile: Watermelon, melon, red fruits and peach
coffees.description: Finca Campo Hermoso (1750-1900 m.a.s.l.) located in Circasia, Quindío, Colombia, is a 25-hectare farm known for its unique experimental coffees. Led by Edwin Noreña, a fourth-generation farmer and coffee innovator, the farm produces exceptional and distinctive profiles. coffees.name: El Romerillo
coffees.description: El Romerillo farm is located in the coffee-growing region of San Ignacio, in northern Peru, an area known for its excellent coffee quality and great coffee activity. At an altitude of 1,700 meters above sea level, El Romerillo benefits from a unique microclimate, with cool temperatures, fertile soils, and great biodiversity, allowing the highest quality coffee beans to be grown. The farm follows sustainable agricultural practices to protect the region's ecosystem, which is ecologically sensitive. Clever Córdova Mejía, the producer, focuses on caring for the environment while producing specialty coffee, making it even more valuable for the global market.

coffees.name: Red Fruits
coffees.description: Finca Campo Hermoso (1750-1900 m.a.s.l.) located in Circasia, Quindío, Colombia, is a 25-hectare farm known for its unique experimental coffees. Led by Edwin Noreña, a fourth-generation farmer and coffee innovator, the farm produces exceptional and distinctive profiles. He has developed a unique co-fermentation technique inspired by the craft beer industry. By adding compounds like hops and dehydrated fruits to the fermentation tanks, Edwin creates distinctive flavors that complement the natural fermentation process.

coffees.name: Kirunga
coffees.profile: Red currant, blueberries, raspberry and chocolate
coffees.description: Rwamatamu Coffee was founded in 2015 by Laetitia Mukantwaza and Gaston Rutaganda, who already had 13 years of experience in Rwanda's coffee sector. The company emerged with the aim of addressing rural poverty through fair wages, stable employment, and support for women in coffee cultivation. In its beginnings, Rwamatamu operated in Nyamasheke, next to Lake Kivu, but over time has expanded its operations, establishing two coffee washing stations in western Rwanda. Rwamatamu's main operations are in the highlands of Rwanda, at altitudes between 1600 and 2000 meters, where climatic conditions and volcanic soils are ideal for growing arabica coffee.
